summary: The Empowering and Enforcing Environmental Justice Act of 2025 establishes an Office of Environmental Justice within the Department of Justice to address environmental justice matters. It defines environmental justice, outlines duties of the Office (including developing a strategy, coordinating matters, and administering grants), and creates a Senior Advisory Council to advise on policy and monitor progress. The bill also authorizes a grant program for state, local, and tribal governments to enforce environmental laws related to environmental justice, funded with $50 million annually.
